txt.en: 'I thank you, [placeholder]. I understand that it was a difficult task, but you have shown both discretion and courtesy in seeing it through.'
You should speak with Duinhir, who can be found at Aragorn's pavilion on the after-battle Pelennor.
Help identify the bodies of Duilin and Derufin among those recovered from the field.

You gently explain that Aragorn has asked Duinhir to identify his sons' bodies.\n\n'I cannot. I have seen so much death. To see theirs... You came to know them well in these last days, did you not? Will you go in my stead?'
Aragorn can be found in his pavilion on the after-battle Pelennor.\n\nYou should return to Aragorn now that you have identified Duilin and Derufin.
Duinhir does not have the strength of mind to identify his sons
You are certain this is the body of Duilin
This is not one of Duinhir's sons
'Would you ask Duinhir if he is willing to identify his sons?'
You are certain this is the body of Derufin
'I thank you. It was a difficult task.'
Search among the slain for Duilin and Derufin's bodies.

'Many corpses have been recovered from the field, some nearly beyond recognition. I fear that Duilin and Derufin, who were trampled by a MÃ»mak, may be among them. Would you ask Duinhir if he is willing to identify his sons?'
